metadata.Description: Systems that convert electrical power into a gas fuel, such as hydrogen or methane.

level 1.Description: Power-to-gas systems implement the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
Power-to-gas systems receive funding from Research and Development initiatives to support their development and implementation.
Power-to-gas systems focus on utilizing renewable energy sources for the production of hydrogen.
Power-to-gas systems play a crucial role in the Energy Transition Strategy by enabling the storage and conversion of excess renewable energy.
Power-to-gas systems partner with Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure to explore synergies in energy storage and distribution.
Power-to-gas systems contribute to achieving carbon neutrality by enabling the conversion of renewable energy into clean hydrogen.
Power-to-gas systems monitor the efficiency of hydrogen production to optimize the overall energy conversion process.
Power-to-gas systems target the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by utilizing renewable energy for hydrogen production.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

level 2.Subject: carbon neutrality
level 2.Description: Carbon neutrality implements Energy Efficiency Policy to reduce carbon emissions and promote sustainable energy practices.

level 2.Subject: carbon neutrality
level 2.Description: Carbon neutrality funds Renewable Energy Projects to support the development and implementation of clean energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

subelement_relations.Description: An electrolyzer is a key component of power-to-gas systems. It uses electricity to split water into hydrogen and oxygen through the process of electrolysis. The hydrogen produced can then be used for various applications, such as energy storage or fuel production.

A methanation reactor is an essential part of power-to-gas systems. It converts hydrogen and carbon dioxide into synthetic natural gas (methane) through a catalytic process. This allows for the storage and utilization of renewable energy in existing natural gas infrastructure.

Gas storage is a crucial component of power-to-gas systems. It involves storing the produced hydrogen or synthetic natural gas for later use when the demand for energy is high or renewable energy generation is low. This enables the system to provide a continuous and reliable energy supply.

Gas grid injection is an important process in power-to-gas systems. It involves injecting the produced hydrogen or synthetic natural gas into the existing natural gas grid infrastructure. This allows for the distribution and utilization of renewable energy in various sectors, such as heating, transportation, and industry.

Power-to-liquid is a related concept to power-to-gas systems. It involves the conversion of renewable electricity and carbon dioxide into liquid fuels, such as synthetic hydrocarbons or biofuels. This process enables the production of sustainable transportation fuels.
